summary: This document is a timeline and financial record detailing the procurement and installation of a comprehensive surveillance camera system at a correctional facility, spanning from September 2018 to October 2019. It lists contracts awarded to vendors Signet, Anixter, and Digital Plaza Direct for equipment, software, and labor, totaling over $1.2 million, and notes staffing challenges during installation.

events.title: $800,000 Allotment Received
events.description: An $800,000 allotment was received, presumably to fund the surveillance system project.

events.title: Signet Contract Awarded
events.description: Contract awarded to Signet for $698,108.00 for 152 cameras, recorders, installation, and various software licenses and hardware components.

events.title: Anixter Contract Awarded
events.description: Contract awarded to Anixter for $34,089.28 for wiring, connectors, and related materials.

events.title: TDY Staff Begin Installation
events.description: Temporary Duty (TDY) staff from the North East Regional Office began a two-week rotation to install cameras. Staff were also used to cover custody posts due to staff shortages, leading to inconsistent project progress.

events.title: Anixter Contract Modified
events.description: Anixter contract modified (Mod 1) for a change in material ordered, with no change to cost.

events.title: Signet Contract for Licenses and Recorders
events.description: Contract awarded to Signet for $160,508.00 for additional licenses, recorders, and installation.

events.title: Signet Contract for Network Hardware
events.description: Contract awarded to Signet for $42,334.76 for patch panels, switches, and related components.

events.title: Digital Plaza Direct Contract Awarded
events.description: Contract awarded to Digital Plaza Direct for $319,300.00 for 475 cameras, 50 mounts, and 10,000 feet of fiber optic cable.

events.title: Anixter Contract Final Modification
events.description: Anixter contract modified (Mod 2 Final Award $24,918.28) for a change in material ordered, reducing the total cost from the original award.

keyFacts: Over $1.2 million was spent between September 2018 and October 2019 to procure and install a large-scale IP surveillance camera system at a correctional facility.
The installation project faced significant staffing challenges, with temporary staff being diverted to cover custody posts, causing inconsistent progress.
The system included hundreds of cameras (IP, Pelco 360/270/180, IR), extensive networking hardware, and enterprise video management software for housing units, visiting rooms, and the perimeter.
Two major funding allotments of $800,000 each were received in September 2018 and October 2019 to finance the project.
The document provides a detailed, itemized breakdown of surveillance equipment purchases, suggesting a planned, comprehensive upgrade to facility security monitoring.
